biography.bio: Rinal Mukhametov was born on August 21, 1989 in Tatarskaya ASSR, USSR as Rinal Albertovitch Mukhametov. He is an actor, known for Attraction (2017), Tri mushketera (2013) and Ekaterina (2014).
biography.name: Rinal Mukhametov

biography.bio: Yuriy Chursin was born on March 11, 1980 as Yuri Anatolyevich Chursin. He is an actor, known for Playing the Victim (2006), Survival Game (2016) and Tri mushketera (2013).
biography.name: Yuriy Chursin

biography.bio: Aleksey Makarov was born on February 15, 1972 in Omsk, RSFSR, USSR. He is an actor, known for Countdown (2004), The Rifleman of the Voroshilov Regiment (1999) and Cheque (2000).
biography.name: Aleksey Makarov

biography.bio: Pavel Barshak was born on December 19, 1980 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR as Pavel Dmitrievich Barshak. He is an actor, known for The Stroll (2003), Nochnoy prodavets (2005) and Piter FM (2006).
biography.name: Pavel Barshak

biography.bio: Vasili Lanovoy is a notable Russian actor best known as Captain Grey in Les Voiles écarlates (1961) and as Anatol Kuragin in War and Peace (1966). He was born Vasili Semenovich Lanovoy on January 16, 1934, in Moscow, Russia, USSR. His parents were Ukrainian peasants living near Odessa. They escaped from death in the famine of 1931 and survived by moving to Moscow. At the age of 7, Lanovoy went to visit his relatives near Odessa, but there he was caught by the advancing Nazi Armies during the Second World War. Young Lanovoy was abused by the Nazis who fired machine guns above his head to scare him, so he stammered for several years as a consequence. However, he had a dream of being an actor, regardless of his stammer and his heavy Ukrainian accent. He attended the acting class of Sergei Lvovich Stein at Moscow ZIL club, and made his stage debut in a play by Lev Kassil. Young Lanovoy was torn between two professions, acting and journalism, and entered to study both. In 1953, at age 18, while a Journalism student of Moscow University, he was cast in Problem Child (1954), making his film debut. From 1953 - 1957 he studied acting at Shchukin Theatrical School of Vakhtangov Theatre in Moscow. There his classmate was Tatyana Samoylova, and they married in 1955, and later became co-stars in Anna Karénine (1967) by director Aleksandr Zarkhi. At the same time he appeared as Anatol Kuragin in War and Peace (1966) by director Sergey Bondarchuk. Since 1957 Vasili Lanovoy has been member of Vakhtangov Theatre in Moscow. There his stage partners were such actors as Mikhail Ulyanov, Ruben Simonov, Boris Zakhava, Mikhail Astangov, Varvara Popova, Irina Kupchenko, Natalya Tenyakova, Yuliya Borisova, Lyudmila Maksakova, Lyudmila Tselikovskaya, Marianna Vertinskaya, Nina Ruslanova, Nikolai Plotnikov, Yuriy Yakovlev, Vladimir Etush, Vyacheslav Shalevich, Andrei Abrikosov, Grigori Abrikosov, Boris Babochkin, Nikolai Gritsenko, Nikolai Timofeyev, Aleksandr Grave, Evgeniy Karelskikh, Sergey Makovetskiy, and Ruben Simonov, among others. His most memorable stage performances were as Protasov in 'Deti Solntsa' (1968), as Oktavian in 'Antony and Cleopatra' (1975), and the title role in 'Kasanova' (1985). Since taking the role as Prince Calaf in 1963, Lanovoy has been delivering acclaimed performances in the legendary Vakhtangov's production of Carlo Gozzi's comedy 'Princess Turandot'. Vasili Lanovoy was designated People's Actor of the USSR, was awarded Lenin's Prize (1980), and received numerous awards and decorations for his works on stage and in film. He is married to actress 'Irina Kupchenko', and the couple has two sons. Outside of his acting profession Lanovoy is fond of listening to classical music and singing Ukrainian songs together with his friends and family. In his 70s, he has been maintaining a good physical form through sports and pesco-vegetarian diet. He is living with his family in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Vasiliy Lanovoy

biography.placeOfBirth: Gorkiy, Gorkovskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR [now Nizhniy Novgorod, Nizhegorodskaya oblast, Russia]
biography.bio: Ekaterina Vilkova was born on July 11, 1984 in Gorkiy, Gorkovskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR as Ekaterina Nikolaevna Vilkova. She is an actress, known for Chernaya Molniya (2009), Hipsters (2008) and PiraMMMida (2011). She has been married to Ilya Lyubimov since May 1, 2011. They have two children.
biography.name: Ekaterina Vilkova

biography.bio: Vladimir Etush is a popular actor and director of the Shchukin Theatrical School of the Vakhtangov Theatre in Moscow. He was born Vladimir Abramovich Etush on May 6, 1922, in Moscow, Russia. His father, Abram Etush, was a small business owner in Moscow and was arrested by the Soviet communists. Young Etush was raised by his single mother, Raisa Etush. As a schoolboy, he was fond of acting and reading, and took part in school productions of Chekhov's plays. In 1941 he entered, but his studies were interrupted by war. During the Second World War he served in the Red Army; he was severely wounded in a battle against the Nazis, and was decorated with the Red Star for his courage. In 1945 he graduated from the Shchukin Theatrical School as an actor. Since 1945 Vladimir Etush has been member of the troupe at There his stage partners were such actors as Mikhail Ulyanov, Ruben Simonov, Boris Zakhava, Mikhail Astangov, Varvara Popova, Irina Kupchenko, Natalya Tenyakova, Yuliya Borisova, Lyudmila Maksakova, Lyudmila Tselikovskaya, Marianna Vertinskaya, Nina Ruslanova, Nikolai Plotnikov, Vasiliy Lanovoy, Yuriy Yakovlev, Vyacheslav Shalevich, Andrei Abrikosov, Grigori Abrikosov, Boris Babochkin, Nikolai Gritsenko, Nikolai Timofeyev, Aleksandr Grave, Evgeniy Karelskikh, Sergey Makovetskiy, and Ruben Simonov, among others. His most memorable stage performances were roles in Shakespeare's 'Two gentlemen from Verona' (1948), as intellectual Dorogomilov in 'No Ordinary Summer' (1955) by Konstantin Fedin, and as Merikur in 'Budte zdorovy' (aka.. Stay well) (1965). Since taking the role as Brigella in 1963, Etush has been delivering acclaimed performances in the legendary Vakhtangov's production of Carlo Gozzi's comedy 'Princess Turandot'. Vladimir Etush is best known for his role as Comrade Saakhov, a hilarious groom in a popular Soviet comedy Kidnapping, Caucasian Style (1967) by director Leonid Gayday. Vladimir Etush was designated People's Actor of the USSR (1984). He has been rector of Shchukin Thgeatrical Schooll of Vakhtangov Theatre in Moscow. He is living in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Vladimir Etush

biography.placeOfBirth: Saratov, Saratov Oblast, RSFSR, USSR [now Russia]
biography.bio: Filipp Yankovskiy was born on October 10, 1968 in Saratov, Saratov Oblast, RSFSR, USSR as Filipp Olegovich Yankovskiy. He is an actor and director, known for The Mirror (1975), Star (2014) and The State Counsellor (2005). He is married to Oksana Fandera. They have one child.
biography.name: Filipp Yankovskiy

biography.bio: Mariya Mironova was born on May 28, 1974 in Moscow, Russian SFSR, USSR as Mariya Andreevna Mironova. She is an actress, known for Night Watch (2004), Day Watch (2006) and Tycoon: A New Russian (2002). She has been married to Aleksey Makarov since November 1, 2011. She was previously married to Igor Udalov and Dmitriy Klokov.
biography.name: Mariya Mironova

biography.bio: Anna Starshenbaum was born on April 26, 1989 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR as Anna Gennadevna Starshenbaum. She is an actress, known for Say Leo (2008), Moy paren - angel (2012) and Fort Ross (2014). She has been married to Aleksey Bardukov since 2009. They have one child.
biography.name: Anna Starshenbaum

biography.placeOfBirth: Rostov-na-Donu, Rostovskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR [now Russia]
biography.bio: Konstantin Lavronenko was born on April 20, 1961 in Rostov-na-Donu, Rostovskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR as Konstantin Nikolaevich Lavronenko. He is an actor, known for The Return (2003), Le bannissement (2007) and Terra Nova (2008).
biography.name: Konstantin Lavronenko

biography.bio: Aleksandr Lykov was born on November 30, 1961 as Aleksandr Anatolyevich Lykov. He is an actor, known for 9th Company (2005), Diversant (2004) and Turetskiy gambit (2005).
biography.name: Aleksandr Lykov

biography.bio: Viktor Rakov was born on February 5, 1962 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR as Viktor Viktorovich Rakov. He is an actor, known for Master i Margarita (1994), Trance (2006) and Mother (1990).
biography.name: Viktor Rakov

biography.bio: Vladimir Zaytsev was born on September 28, 1958 in Sverdlovsk, RSFSR, USSR as Vladimir Ivanovich Zaytsev. He is an actor, known for Le barbier de Sibérie (1998), Protiv techeniya (1981) and Tridtsat sedmoy roman (2011).
biography.name: Vladimir Zaytsev

biography.bio: Kseniya Kutepova was born on August 1, 1971 in Moscow, Russian SFSR, USSR as Ksenia Pavlovna Kutepova. She is an actress, known for Travelling with Pets (2007), Skoro vesna (2009) and The Stroll (2003). She is married to Sergey Osipyan. They have two children.
biography.name: Kseniya Kutepova
